content: How old are we talking, what's the cut-off age? I can see drawing the line somewhere. Is it a three-year-old's fault if her parents carry her over illegally? Does she not deserve an education, even though she's fluent in English, having learned it by the first grade, and her Spanish is still that of a five or six year old, since she lives in an English-majority country. All of her classmates are applying for Federal aid for college, but she has to pay out-of-state Foreign Student Rates - which her family can't afford. (This is one possible scenario. Obviously every individual would vary in age of entry into the U.S., parental income, and English fluency.) But then again, a Mexican university degree is certainly a possibility for a Mexican citizen, though this opportunity is harder to achieve there than it is here. I can kind of see an argument on both sides here...
